info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:27PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Routt County through 500 PM MDT... At 426 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Steamboat Springs, or 40 miles east of Craig, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Routt County. This includes U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 129 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
